Posts.Content: beth1118 wrote: I have been taking xeloda for 6 mts now.  My only side affect is hand and foot syndrom.   My fingers are peeling and cracking and so are my feet.  I have had 2 pet scans since starting xeloda,  and my cancer is shrinking.  I had breast cancer and was cancer free for 2 1/2 years. I had pain in my ribs which was assumed to be something I did.  Then 6 mts later I still complained my ribs hurt,  and find out its cancer.  The cancer was also in my pelvis and my liver.  After 6 mts on xeloda,  and my last pet scan.  The cancer in my pelvis is gone.  the cancer in my liver has shrunk to 1.1cm from 4.3cm and the cancer in my ribs is shrinking too.  Now,  the dr wants to switch me to femara.  Why?  When the xeloda is working.  He says its slower to work than the xeloda.  And that the xeloda was a jump start to get it to shrink.  I dont want to stop the xeloda  until the pet scans are clear.  Next one is Feb sometime.  I would really like to hear from someone who started on xeloda and was switched to femara.  Please,  someone ...... Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: xeloda vs femara beth1118

Posts.Content: Dec 17, 2012 07:43PM beth1118 wrote: My dr wants to stop the xeloda and start the femara.  I dont like the hand and foot syndrom but its so much better than IV chemo.   I want all the cancer to be gone on the xeloda before I switch, not sure the dr thinks that yet.  He wants to talk about it when I go back in January.   My tumor marker CA27-29 was up to 105 and last weeks tests showed 24.3.  To me,  thats awesome,  but not good enough.  Its been as low as 16.
Posts.Title: xeloda vs femara beth1118
